title.rendered: Art Hearts Fashion Celebrates 9-Year Anniversary for LA Fashion Week

content.rendered:
Art Hearts Fashion Celebrates 9-Year Anniversary and Hispanic Heritage Month by Collaborating With LA Fashion Districts Los Angeles Market Week in DTLA For LA Fashion Week Featuring Four Days of Iconic and Emerging Fashion Runway Shows.


Los Angeles, CA As one of the only LatinX fashion runway production brands and biggest organization to put on globally recognized Fashion Week events, Art Hearts Fashion is reimagining LA Fashion Week 2022 with a series of iconic runway fashion shows featuring more than 25 globally recognized and emerging local fashion brands at the historical Majestic DTLA (650 S Spring St, Los Angeles, CA 90014) from Oct. 13th through Oct. 16th, 2022.


Off the heels of New York Fashion Week and Miami Swim Week successful runway shows featuring a diverse list of top celebrities, models and influencers including WWE wrestlers  Sasha Banks (Mercedes Varnado) and Naomi (Trinity Fatu) as well as Indian Model and Miss Universe 2021, Tik Tok Influencer Bryan the Diamond; Singer Sicily Rose; TikToker Emma Norton; Harnaaz Kaur Sandhu; Miss Universe Thailand 2022; Real Housewives of Miami and ex-wife of NBA player Scottie Pippen, Larsa Pippen; Netflixs Selling Tampa real estate reality star, Anne Sophie Petit-Frre, LGBT+ International Activist Elton Ilirjani, and this years LA Fashion Week is sure to make a lasting impact on the next years trending fashion looks and styles. 


Some of the top brands showcasing at this years Los Angeles Fashion Week runway shows include Nike Swim, Dr. Martens, Black Tape Project, Mister Triple X, Walter Mendez, and Custo Barcelona to name a few. Tickets to the various ArtHearts Fashion runway shows are available online for purchase. In addition, Art Hearts is selling Ultimate Insider Access Passes to their Los Angeles Fashion Week shows on CharityBuzz with 100 percent of the proceeds going directly to the Make-a-Wish Foundation. Weve developed a unique experience package for fashion lovers to bid on and get the full experience of Los Angeles Fashion Week the ultimate raffle winners will get seated the first row at our fashion shows, have their makeup done by our backstage makeup artists, plus get hair and fashion styling and meet the designers, me and my team putting on this years shows. Best of all they get to pay to get glammed and enjoy fashion while supporting a wonderful cause to help kids and adults with terminal diseases that need support,  Rosete stated.


This year also marks the ninth year anchoring LA as a major fashion hub while also uplifting and celebrating LatinX designers, something Art Hearts Fashion has proactively and consciously done over the course of its 11-year fashion show programming as an organization that is primarily LatinX with a Latino founder/president.


Art Hearts Fashion is also pleased to make this years Los Angeles Fashion Week bigger and better by collaborating with the LA Fashion Districts various wholesale showrooms to jointly host LA Market Week, which consists of a series of fashion events, activations, and networking gatherings for emerging and established LA designers, fashion buyers and other noteworthy attendees who work in the fashion industry. Art Hearts Fashion is strategically collaborating with the Fashion Business Improvement District (BID) and its partners for this new expansion to Los Angeles Fashion Week including The New Mart, The Cooper Building, The California Market Center, Lady Liberty Building, Brand Assembly, the California Fashion Association and Fashion TechWorks. Los Angeles Fashion Week and LA Market Week are happening simultaneously at the same time in the same three-block radius of downtown LA this year, which is monumental! This expands, reimagines and elevates the traditional fashion week formula by incorporating experiences and partnerships with added venues, trade shows, showrooms, venues and runway shows that ultimately creates a collaborative atmosphere between boutique & couture brands and fashion lovers alike, said Erik Rosete, founder and president of Art Hearts Fashion.


LA Market Weeks staple trade show has become the West Coasts premier fashion trade show for contemporary apparel and accessories and will be instrumental in scaling this years Los Angeles Fashion Week.  The Fashion Week Hub at Fashion Techworks will also serve as the buyers lounge, and a home base for designers to incorporate their state of the art facilities to conduct live podcast shows, fashion industry workshops, fittings, and preparations for Los Angeles Fashion Week, Rosete continued.


This years LA Market Week will take place inside the New Marts Fashion TechWorks Buyers Lounge & Fashion Pavillion spaces in downtown LA located at 127 E. Ninth Street from Sunday, Oct. 9, 2022 until Oct. 16th, 2022.  Were excited that this new hybrid fashion week experience will become a major staple in the world of fashion while boosting and innovating the local LA fashion industry, Rosete stated. 


On Monday, October 10th, The Fashion Business District is hosting a kick-off block party by closing  9th Street from Main to Los Angeles Street, from 2 p.m. to 8 p.m., in collaboration with Art Hearts Fashion and the major fashion showrooms participating in LA Market Week. Art Hearts Fashions official opening kickoff runway event for Los Angeles Fashion Week will take place on October 13th, with doors opening at 6:30 p.m. and shows starting at 7:30 p.m. at the Majestic DTLA, with dozens of fashion influencers, local celebrities, designers, buyers, and fashion insiders expected to be in attendance.


Top sponsors of this years Los Angeles Fashion Week include Japonesque, Icon Hair, Rockstar Energy, and Billion Dollar Brows.  The official afterparties for Los Angeles Fashion Week will begin Thursday night at The Reserve and continue at the same venue Friday and Saturday night, with the official Sunday Closing Night Gala scheduled to take place at The Majestic following the final runway show. VIP private influencer, invite-only afterparties will take place at the Aster Place Members Club. For ticketing, bottle services and guest list details and booking, please visit  https://thelareserve.com/events/.


Featured Fashion Brands Partaking in Art Hearts Fashions LA Fashion Week Runway Shows:


Nike Swim - Globally recognized premium athletic swim and workout apparel brand


Walter Mendez - Latin couture womens fashion designer based in LA known for  dressing top celebrities throughout LA


Carlos Pineda - Flamenco-inspired heritage Mexican silhouettes featuring layered fabrics and ruffled womens dresses


Diana Couture - Custom couture womens fashion gowns & iconic luxury ensembles designed by Diana M. Putri.


Mister Triple X - High-end, street-wear mens fashion line conceived through a story told through fashion by ArtHearts Fashion founder/president, Erik Rosete.


Dr Martens - Iconic global brand british footwear and clothing brand known for boots, shoes, sandals & accessories. 


Charles and Ron - Contemporary lifestyle brand, high-end clothing, and bags with a distinct Mediterranean flair and a dedication to superior quality.


Morfium Fashion - Luxury couture womens fashion brand


Kentaro Kameyama - Japanese designer who is a recent winner of Bravo TVs emmy-nominated Project Runway Season 16 will present a new minimalist 


Custo Barcelona - Global modern and elegant haute couture fashion brand from Spain


Alexis Monsanto - Exquisitely tailored womens fashion brand inspired by Salvador Dali and Pablo Picasso, based in West Hollywood. 


Original Penguin - Iconic original American clothing line originally founded in the 1950s, the brand specializes in clothing, footwear, and eyewear for men.


MM Milano - Sustainable Fashion brand known for designing beautiful womens and young girls gowns and dresses.


Tell The Truth - Hand-made American fashion brand for men and women


Black Tape Project - Iconic and controversial body tape swimwear fashion brand


Jesus De La Garza - Feminine and exquisite womens luxury couture fashion brand from Mexico


Merlin Castell - Vibrant namesake fashion designer known for magnificent and luxurious womens fashion designs


Kenneth Barlis - Sustainable, affordable luxury womens fashion brand highlighting body positivity and gender inclusivity fashion for men and women by Bravo TVs Project Runway Season 19 alumni, Kenneth Barlis.


Nauhty Boy Golf - Hats and accessories that appeal to a younger demographic and golfers who not only want to fearlessly conquer.


Anthony Rubio - Canine Couture from internationally acclaimed pet couturier and women's Wear designer. 


Joseph Auren - Futuristic mens fashion wear known for geometric cuts, visual optical effects, and bondage elements.



About Art Hearts Fashion

Art Hearts Fashion is the leading fashion production company & platform dedicated to bringing innovative designers and artists to the forefront of fashion week. The companys coast-to-coast contemporary events enterprise brings together the most renowned and sharpest up-and-coming emerging designers and iconic brands to the runway in New York, Los Angeles, Miami, and beyond. Founded in 2010, AHF has become a driving force for fashion, art, and entertainment. The shows have featured designers including Nike Swim, Body Glove, Camilla, Custo Barcelona, Nicole Miller, Carmen Steffens, Hale Bob, Michael Costello, Trina Turk, Orlebar Brown, Patbo, Furne Amato, Walter Mendez, Vilebrequin, Jovani, Black Tape Project, Mister Triple X, and Michael NGO. Art Hearts Fashion is the largest and longest running Fashion Week production company in the United States. Purchase tickets to LA Fashion Week online at thttps://www.eventbrite.com/e/los-angeles-fashion-week-powered-by-art-hearts-fashion-tickets-425997860067. To learn more, visit ArtHeartsFashion.com. 


ABOUT LA Fashion Business Improvement District 


The LA Fashion District Business Improvement District (BID) is a private, non-profit corporation created and maintained by property owners dedicated to serving the LA Fashion District community -- businesses, employees, residents, visitors, and more. The organizations mission is to help facilitate and provide a clean, safe, and friendly place to work, shop, live, and do business. The organization oversees and serves a 107-block area generally between 7th Street to the north and the Santa Monica 10 Freeway to the south, and from Broadway to the west and Paloma Street to the east. The LA Fashion District BID is one of 9 BIDs in Downtown LA and one of over 40 BIDs in the City of Los Angeles and is overseen by a 15-member Board of Directors, which are elected by district property owners. NOTE: Market Week is a trade-only event. You must own or work for a licensed retail business to purchase wholesale. Buyers and retailers wishing to attend LA Market Weeks will need to register at each building. To learn more about LA Fashion BID, please visit www.fashiondistrict.org.
